intro: Thouinia domingensis var. domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are edible but often have a bitter taste. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in open, sunny areas with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
